page.title: 15LIFE IN CARTHEW
page.content: Old residents of Carthew were asked how life has changed in the village during the last 50 years: COMMUNITY SPIRIT: Recently, many new people have settled in the village and the community spirit is less. WORK: People no longer have to work to survive. Machines have replaced manual work. Unemployment has risen to 17%. WATER AND SANITATION: People used to collect water in pitchers from a well and take lavatory buckets down to the river. Now each house has its own indoor toilet and taps supply hot and cold water. AMUSEMENTS: Card games, Chapel concerts and walks have been replaced by the radio and television. TRANSPORT: A steam train used to carry clay from Carthew, now replaced by lorries. Formerly, people used to cycle or walk, now most rely on cars.
